definitions.definition: To secure the release of an arrested person by providing bail .
( law ) To release a person under such guarantee.
( law ) To hand over personal property to be held temporarily by another as a bailment .
examples: to bail cloth to a tailor to be made into a garment; to bail goods to a carrier

definitions.definition: ( nautical , transitive , intransitive ) To remove (water) from a boat by scooping it out.
examples: to bail water out of a boat

definitions.definition: ( nautical , transitive ) To remove water from (a boat) by scooping it out.
To set free; to deliver; to release.

main_definition: To secure the release of an arrested person by providing bail .
secondary_definitions: ( law ) To release a person under such guarantee.
( law ) To hand over personal property to be held temporarily by another as a bailment .
( nautical , transitive , intransitive ) To remove (water) from a boat by scooping it out.
( nautical , transitive ) To remove water from (a boat) by scooping it out.
To set free; to deliver; to release.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang ) To leave or exit abruptly .
examples: With his engine in flames, the pilot had no choice but to bail .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , informal ) To fail to meet a commitment (to a person). [ with on ‘someone’ ]

main_definition: ( intransitive , slang ) To leave or exit abruptly .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , informal ) To fail to meet a commitment (to a person). [ with on ‘someone’ ]

definitions.definition: To secure the head of a cow during milking.

main_definition: To secure the head of a cow during milking.

definitions.definition: To secure (a cow) by placing its head in a bail for milking.
To keep (a traveller) detained in order to rob them; to corner (a wild animal); loosely, to detain , hold up .
definitions.label_groups: Australia , New Zealand , usually with up

secondary_definitions: ( Australia , New Zealand ) To secure (a cow) by placing its head in a bail for milking.
( Australia , New Zealand , usually with up ) To keep (a traveller) detained in order to rob them; to corner (a wild animal); loosely, to detain , hold up .
